Reviews.Title: “Please take the time to look elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: MaryEAmon
Reviews.Content: Although this is situated close to the termini, I believe we could have found another great location and better deal all the way around had we looked more throughly. The bathroom is awful, mildew and falling apart. We came back to the room after a long days journey in a hot and muggy rome to find that the hot water heater was broken and we could not shower. We were given no compensation for this. When I went down to inquire about it the staff member blew it off as if it was no concern. I asked it they had bottled water for guest. He replied that they had both flat and gas available for the guest in such an overly generous way I thought that the water was complimentary...it was not! They did take it off the bill though. Worst for last: The beds are so old that we were sinking in the middle. They pushed two singles together for our 4 night stay which was a nightmare...I am a creature of habit with certain things and falling asleep with the heavy arm of my handsome beloved over me is an absolute must...we could not get comfortable at all!!!!The beds sagged at different areas and even when we did try our best to snuggle, the beds moved apart. The staff was nice, but not enough to way out the other conditions. The wi-fi was free but someone was always on the house computer and we didn't cart ours on our trip. The breakfast was the same everyday. Although I have an understanding that breakfast is not a big meal for Italians, I also have an understanding that it could have been vast improved. The rolls were stale, the packaged cookies and wafers low quality, the coffee the worst you could possibly imagine (and I have had incredible Italian coffee), boxed corn flakes and warm milk galore...a total carb/sugar breakfast guaranteed to have your blood sugar crashing, head ache pounding, dehydrated start to your journey in history thick Rome where you just might have wanted to start out nourished, well slept, and comfortably bathed. I did actually take photos of the mold in the bathroom, but I can't get them to load up and we decided I should just go ahead and get our reviews posted.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: aviator44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Igea for 1 night at both the beginning and end of a tour we booked to see Northern Italy. Rome being very expensive, this was affordable and very clean within walking distance to all sights. 3 min. from Termini Station it was very convenient. The staff was very helpful in providing a map and directing us to our sightseeing. They were generous in allowing us to take a bagged breakfast since our tour was leaving earlier than the breakfast room opened. They even kept our extra baggage for no extra fee while we took our 5 day tour. Please note that if you're traveling in Europe and expecting the same star rating for hotels there as you would in North America you are being unfair in your expectations. This hotel is old, elevator is small and beds are both small and basic (NOT a Shertaton pillowtop mattress by any means) but it is what you need to accept for a hotel in Europe. Paying double what you would for the same hotel in North America is to expected. Having said that, I would consider this hotel cleaner than almost all the Holiday Inns or Comfort Inns I've ever stayed at. They had free use of the computer and WIFI in the lobby. If you were to compare this hotel to any of the others in the area, you would be hardpressed to find anything cheaper that is as good as this one. We would definately stay at this hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Low value for money”
Reviews.Author: Daniella S
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights, the hotel is very near the Termini station (5 min walking) and lots of restaurants. We could do almost everything by foot, using the metro once in a while. The staff is friendly but hardly speaks English. The breakfast is ok, but no fruits or other things beside croissants, cornflakes and some sweet breads. The bathroom is very small and had a leaking in the ceiling, that was fixed in the next day. Considering other hotels that we stayed in Europe, this one was expensive if we compare the quality of the rooms and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Free WiFi”
Reviews.Author: Kristjan84
Reviews.Content: There are many hotels on this street. This hotels offers free WiFi which was of much delight after spending an evening in the hotel right beside this one (Terminal, I believe it was called) which charges €12 per day. Also, across the street you will get WiFi at a wonderful restaurant with some delicious seafood pasta. The entire area Seemed safe and no one had a problem with speaking English.

Reviews.Title: “Should not be the first option”
Reviews.Author: SukantaSaha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is over priced. no way it is a 3* hotel. I better rate this as a good hostel. The only positive thing is the location. But there are 100s of other hotels in that neighbourhood so there is an option to try alternatives The breakfast was not satisfactory may be because I don't like hard breads. room was clean but not at all upto the mark. The main problem is the structure of the hotel building. This is an early 19th century house converted into hotel and my room was very small. May be I am not familiar with normal rates of rome hotels, but I dont think such a hotel deserves 60Euro/night. The overall apperance of the hotel, its unstructured small lobby, tiny clumsy lift was sufficient to reduce half of my excitment about this trip. The person who was handing the breakfast room and the odd hour reception is somewhat rude and occationally misbehaved. The wifi access zone only covers the tiny lounge. not connectable from room. It is a better idea to avoid this hotel as much as possible.

Reviews.Title: “It is OK”
Reviews.Author: notsohappyDenver
Reviews.Content: Great location if you want to be close to the Main Train Station in Rome. Clean, helpful employees. Continental Breakfast is OK. The biggest problem is that tit seems that they added the elevator lately. The elevator landing does not align with the hotel upper levels. When you leave the elevator you have to use half a floor stair flight (up or down)???? It was hard if you have heavy bags. If you have wheelchair, forget it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely budget hotel in the heart of Padova”
Reviews.Author: Londonderrychaz
Reviews.Content: Myself and my mum had a very pleasurable experience during our 6 day stay at this hotel. Vivanna, Elisabetta and the rest of the staff were extremely accommodating and always had a smile for the guests. The y took time to talk with us and ensure that we were facilitated in the best way possible. The room was very clean, airy and spacious and the location was just 5 mins from via Roma ( a main shopping street) and St. Anthony's basillica. I would definitely stay here again! From a very contented guest.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect as a low-cost base to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: beng23586
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I (both mid 20's) spent 3 nights at the Igea in March. We booked at short notice (2 weeks) and it was the best value and highest rated hotel available in a central location. The hotel is located in the streets around the main Termini station. Its not the nicest neighborhood, but we never felt unsafe at night. If you come from Fiumicino its only a 5 minute walk from the station so you can check in straight away. All the main sites in the city can be easily reached on foot in under 30 mins, apart from the Vatican which we took the metro to (but we wish we had walked as it makes the tube seem fun). There are a host of very good restaurants in the area, most seem better value than the ones in the central areas and the food was excellent. Our room was basic, but clean and comfortable. The overall decor was very strange, like something out of the 70's (so i've been told, i'm only 25) but it was all in good condition. There was a/c but it wasn't needed. The beds were firm but luckily we both prefer it that way. The only gripe was that the double was just two singles done up separately, and they drift apart from each other on the tiled floor. The bathroom was (very) small but perfectly functional. The room was very quiet, and the only real thing wrong was the fact the TV didn't work, but we weren't in Rome to watch Italian TV! The hotel is very smart and clean. There is free internet in the lobby and the staff are English speaking, friendly and helpful. There was a simple breakfast included, which consisted of 'tea', coffee and a selection of pastries. It was basic and not to our personal taste, but you get what you pay for and it makes getting out to explore the city much more pleasant. In conclusion, this is not a luxury hotel by any means, but if you want a comfortable and convenient base to explore the city and don't want to blow the budget then I would highly recommend it. Rome is a fascinating city, even for someone like myself with no interest in Art or Religion. We got very unlucky with the weather, with almost constant heavy rain. Must sees are the Colosseum, Pantheon, Palatino and obviously the Vatican. It is a very expensive city however (and Im from London), so be prepared to spend.

Reviews.Title: “nice room, nice staff, close to train station”
Reviews.Author: knpderby
Reviews.Content: rome is very expensive so don't expect much for your money - while we paid more here than any other city we visited in Italy, it was nice and very central. breakfast was in the price and was a nice continental. would recommend if you don't have loads of money to spend on hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tashahd
Reviews.Content: The staff here was very kind, and the service was very helpful. No wifi in the room, but there was in the lobby and a computer downstairs free to use. Breakfast was just some pastries/drinks, but was nice to have and the waiter was very kind. Cappucino and hot chocolate was DELICIOUS :) The room was very nice, clean, and I would say the only downside was the 2 beds pushed together to serve as 1, but I heard that is common throughout Europe. Don't know about the reviews below, but noise was not a problem :) The location may look questionable at first, but it is very safe and has plenty of nice restaurants around. Excellent also as it is a less than 5 min. walk to the metro/train station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel In good location but noisy at the mornings”
Reviews.Author: ZoharLerman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel on our trip to Rome. The hotel is reasonably ok, rooms are noisy in mornings. Location is very near to the Rome station (I recommend using the Metro). Staff is very nice and friendly. There is no internet in the rooms (just in the lobby)

Reviews.Title: “Noisy place.. Ok for short stays”
Reviews.Author: mundiani
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel on our last night in Rome. Hotel is reasonably ok, rooms are noisy in evenings. Location is very near to the rome station which is good. Staff is just about ok (The waiter at the breakfast was quite grumpy when asked for a hot chocolate!). Its ok for short stays if you are looking for a economical option.

Reviews.Title: “Clean basic hotel - a good base for Rome.”
Reviews.Author: UKChris82
Reviews.Content: We booked here for our short break to Rome for £80 per night, which I thought was a good deal for what it is worth, hence the 4 star rating - based on value for money. The hotel is located near the station, making it a good base for getting around - despite not being in the heart of all the action, the Colloseo is 10-15 mins walk away, and the historic centre slightly further. If you are willing to walk (or use the Metro (we only used it to get to St. Peters for our early morning tour)) it is a good base. Yes there is noise outside, and you want the windows open so you can have a breeze, but which city isn't noisy? They do need to sort out the air con though. The shutters do make it completely black should you wish to close them. The room is small, but very clean, and you'll spend so little time in it it doesn't matter. The beds are very firm and very small and as with most continental hotels we were given 2 beds pushed together as oppose to a double. The lift is something from the 70s, which stops at every mid level, so you do need to carry luggage (not that we had much), up/down a flight of stairs. Breakfast was poor, cornflakes, bread and coissants, as well as juice and coffee, but you'd expect some fruit/ continental meats for it to be worth going! Watch-out: Free wifi - but only in the reception, not your hotel room. All in all it's very clean, and with a make-over to update it and repairs to the air con, it would be worth a higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “basic hotel, good friendly staff, get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: nottslucy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Igea - less than 5 mins walk from the station - good location for a lot of the sites either by walking or jumping back on the underground. However noisy on streets at night and couldnt shut windows due to air conditioning not working. Hotel basic budget hotel - room very clean, small bathroom but nice hot, powerful shower. Breakfast a little basic but fresh bread rolls and cornflakes and other cereals. Staff really friendly and helpful. Only criticism was that the air conditioning didnt work and when we enquired we were told it wasnt hot enough to have it on yet - it may not have been hot to them but it was very hot to us especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: dreamiegurl
Reviews.Content: Best location. Nearby to everything even to halal shops. Breakfast is good and the room is clean. Worth with what you paying for. It would be better if they have a coffee bar in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but near the stations.”
Reviews.Author: brit1222
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel because of BA dispute so arrived 2 days early for a wedding. 2 blocks away from Station Termine good, but location is in a street full of noisy restaurants whose diners set off numerous car alarms between the shouting and singing sessions. At 4 am the restaurants then began chucking out the empty bottles and throwing rubbish out. A friend who had a room at the rear was content. The tour touts were a nuisance but for 30 Euros extra they reckon that they can jump the main 60 minute queues ( St Peters - admission free normally and the Cistene chapel & museums entry 15 euros) by getting you into a group.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hospitality, centrally located. Noise on street side room.”
Reviews.Author: amitamr
Reviews.Content: Igea hotel is centrally located and very near to termini station. The gentleman at reception is really good and helpful. He helped us out of way and really appreciate it. The rooms facing on street side have noise problem. You have lots of disturbance from street. Also the air conditioning seems was not ok. Break fast is really good .

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for city break”
Reviews.Author: KataloyKid
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be just what we were looking for. Central location near the main station and could walk to most of the sights. Staff were nice and hotel clean and quite quiet for the city centre. Would use this hotel again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly and Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: libri013
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Igea in 2007 and was very happy with my choice. Getting there was easy, straight off my flight and on to the train into Rome. Very quick walk from Termini to the Igea and an easy, friendly check in. The igea is very conveniently situated near to the bus station, metro and termini. My room faced the rear courtyard and I enjoyed the glimpse of Roman life through my window. The room was quite large, not lavishly furnished, but very clean and comfortable and I was very satisified. Clean bathroom where everything worked, crisp new linens and towels daily. As per other reviews, yes the shower was small, but it worked well and was very welcome after a day walking around Rome. Staff were great . When, (despite confirmations), I had a problem with pick ups for 2 tours, they called the tour operators for me and helped to straighten things out. They also packed me a, "bag of breakfast" , when I had a very early start for a tour to Pompei. I was travelling alone and felt completely safe both at the Igea and dining out in the area at night. I loved Rome and nothing about the Igea spoiled that for me. I stayed 5 nights and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean, Central”
Reviews.Author: lizzyDumfries
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in April/May 2005. It was friendly, clean and very central. It had everything we wanted and was a few minutes walk from central station. Our room was on the top floor (6th floor) at the back and looked out onto a central (and very interesting) courtyard. It was large, airy, ensuite with double bed and had more than adequate space for our luggage. There was fresh linen every day. It had a lift and breakfast room. Breakfast was great. I have coeliac and it was no problem for staff to provide a gluten free breakfast for me.Whilst in Rome no-one spends much time in their hotel as there is too much to see and do. Rates were very reasonable. Don't pay for expensive hotels in Rome as you won't spend any time in them . Rome is a wonderful city and this hotel was more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the category”
Reviews.Author: PMHaverhill
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Hotel Igea in September 2005 and found it to be very nice. Manuela made the stay very pleasant. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “The other side of the coin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for almost 2 weeks las summer. Manuela, the owner's daughter wasvery courteous with my family. Romualdo (the guy who served breakfast) was serious but after 2 day was smiling ( I dont kno if this is his real name. The neighborhood is ok like any other big city. I would dstay again there, Manuela made the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: whp81
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome with a reservation at another hotel that was so bad, we decided not to stay there, and on top of that it was New Years Eve, so almost everything was booked. We headed to the train station area because there were so many hotels there. The rooms really do look like dorm rooms. The maids entered our room twice without even knocking. The walls are so thin we heard the man in the room next door snoring all night. The good thing about this hotel is that it encourages you to spend as little time as possbile in your room, and another benefit is that there are a lot of prositutes on the street outside. My advice: when in Rome, don't stay near the train station, and if you have to, don't stay at this hotel.
